clinical_study.brief_title: A Registered Cohort Study on SMA
clinical_study.official_title: A Registered Cohort Study on Spinal Muscular Atrophy
clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) is an autosomal recessive disease that causes progressive muscle wasting and weakness due to loss of motor neurons in the spinal cord. This is a registered cohort of spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) type Iï¼ŒII and III in China. This study will provide further insights into the clinical course of SMA including overall survival, demographic characteristics, motor function, respiratory support, feeding and nutritional support, growth and development. The correlation of genotype and phenotype will be conducted.

primary_outcome.description: Genotype is defined by survival motor neuron (SMN) 2 copy number(s) and phenotype is defined by clinical types and characteristics.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Relatives of SMA patients and carriers

study_pop.textblock: SMA patients are diagnosed with SMN1 gene deletion or mutation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with SMA types I, II and III
- Asymptomatic SMA carriers
- Relatives of SMA patients or carriers
- Unrelated healthy controls
- Participants or Parent(s)/legal guardian(s) willing and able to complete the informed consent process
Exclusion Criteria:
* Participants are unable to comply with trial procedures and visit schedule
